result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Alan Wood

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:25 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 09:11 AM  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears in person with Atty Lipske appearing via Zoom on def's behalf.  Atty Lipske indicates has gone through complaint, waives reading.  Waives TL for prelim on Count #1, set for PTC with DA, per Atty Lipske.  NG on misd count.  PTC June 30 at 9:00 a.m.  Court appoints Atty Lipske on case.  DA clarifies bond is still intact and includes phone contact.  Atty Lipske indicates he has made some contact with victim.  Adj.  9:15 a.m.  klr
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency (not notarized)
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:19 AM Defendant Gregory Alan Wood in court. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def indicates he does not qualify for PD.  Def requests court-appointed atty.  Court questions def re income/assets.  Def given petition for atty.  5/16 at 9:00 a.m. for AIA.  Bond continues.  Adj.  9:22 a.m.  klr
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:17 AM Defendant Gregory Alan Wood in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Bond already set.  Court questions def re attorney.  Def indicates just planned to plead NC.  Court explains plea process and rt to atty.  Case to be rescheduled for initial appearance.  May 2nd at 9:00 a.m.  Bond conditions remain in place.  Def understands.  Adj.  9:21 a.m.  klr

3/23 Bond Hrg. Minutes:  11:11 a.m.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def identifies himself.  Court explains hrg.  Public def info has been provided.  Lt. Foryan sworn in, direct by DA.  Court questions Lt. briefly.  Lt. excused.  Original PC statement given to Court.  Court finds PC to support charges.  DA requests bail/bond of NC with vic listed in PC statement.  No alc use or cons.  $1500 cash.  Court questions DA.  DA complied with Vic Rts.  Def understands request.  Indicates cannot afford $1500 cash.  Def indicates can find some place to go since they live together.  Court sets $1,000 sig bond with conditions of no contact with complaining vic in case.  Should arrange to have Sheriff's Dept. accompany if needed.  4/11 at 9:00 a.m. for INIT.  Complaint will be filed.  Def advised to contact PD's office ASAP.  Court reiterates bond conditions to def.  Adj.  11:21 a.m.  klr
